title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient
name: BigQueryClient
description:
Google Cloud BigQuery allows you to create, manage, share and query data.

Find more information at the Google Cloud BigQuery Docs.

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Create a BigQuery client.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: The hostname with optional port to use in place of the default service endpoint. Example: foobar.com or foobar.com:1234.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.credentialsFetcher
params.description: A credentials fetcher instance.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.requestTimeout
params.description: Seconds to wait before timing out the request. Defaults to 0 with REST and 60 with gRPC.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

params.name: config.location
params.description: If provided, determines the default geographic location used when creating datasets and managing jobs. Please note: This is only required for jobs started outside of the US and EU regions. Also, if location metadata has already been fetched over the network it will take precedent over this setting (by calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::reload(), for example).

methods.name: query
methods.description:
Returns a job configuration to be passed to either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::startQuery(). A configuration can be built using fluent setters or by providing a full set of options at once.

Unless otherwise specified, all configuration options will default based on the query job configuration except for configuration.query.useLegacySql, which defaults to false in this client.

examples.caption: This is equivalent to the above example, using array configuration instead of fluent setters.
Set a region to run the job in.

params.name: query
params.description: A BigQuery SQL query.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.configuration
params.description: Job configuration. Please see the API documentation for the available options.

params.name: options.configuration.query
params.description: Query job configuration. Please see the documentation for the available options.

methods.name: queryConfig
methods.description:
Returns a job configuration to be passed to either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::startQuery(). A configuration can be built using fluent setters or by providing a full set of options at once.

Unless otherwise specified, all configuration options will default based on the query job configuration except for configuration.query.useLegacySql, which defaults to false in this client.

As this method is an alias, please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::query() for usage examples.

params.name: query
params.description: A BigQuery SQL query.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.configuration
params.description: Job configuration. Please see the API documentation for the available options.

params.name: options.configuration.query
params.description: Query job configuration. Please see the documentation for the available options.

methods.name: runQuery
methods.description:
Runs a BigQuery SQL query in a synchronous fashion.

This method is ideal for queries which return results quickly - otherwise we highly recommend utilizing Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::startQuery() as it provides better mechanisms for fine grained control over result polling.

Unless $options.maxRetries is specified, this method will block until the query completes, at which time the result set will be returned.

Queries constructed using standard SQL can take advantage of parameterization.

Refer to the table below for a guide on how parameter types are mapped to their BigQuery equivalents.

PHP Type BigQuery Data Type
\DateTimeInterface DATETIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Bytes BYTES
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Date DATE
Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 INT64
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Time TIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Timestamp TIMESTAMP
Associative Array STRUCT
Non-Associative Array ARRAY
float FLOAT64
int INT64
string STRING
resource BYTES
bool BOOL
object (Outside types specified above) ERROR InvalidArgumentException

examples.caption: Construct a query utilizing named parameters.
Construct a query utilizing positional parameters.

params.name: query
params.description: A BigQuery SQL query configuration.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of rows to return per page of results. Setting this flag to a small value such as 1000 and then paging through results might improve reliability when the query result set is large.

params.name: options.startIndex
params.description: Zero-based index of the starting row.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: How long, in milliseconds, each API call will wait for query results to become available before timing out. Depending on whether the $maxRetries has been exceeded, the results will be polled again after the timeout has been reached. Defaults to 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to poll the Job status, until the job is complete. By default, will poll indefinitely.

params.name: options.returnRawResults
params.description: Returns the raw data types returned from BigQuery without converting their values into native PHP types or the custom type classes supported by this library.

exceptions.description:
If the maximum number of retries while waiting for
query completion has been exceeded.

methods.name: startQuery
methods.description:
Runs a BigQuery SQL query in an asynchronous fashion.

Queries constructed using standard SQL can take advantage of parameterization. For more details and examples please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery().

params.name: query
params.description: A BigQuery SQL query configuration.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: job
methods.description: Lazily instantiates a job. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a job please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the already run or running job to request.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.location
params.description: The geographic location of the job. Required for jobs started outside of the US and EU regions. Defaults to a location specified in the client configuration.

methods.name: jobs
methods.description: Fetches jobs in the project.

examples.caption: Get all jobs with the state of 'done'

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.allUsers
params.description: Whether to display jobs owned by all users in the project. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.stateFilter
params.description: Filter for job state. Maybe be either done, pending, or running.

params.name: options.maxCreationTime
params.description: Milliseconds since the POSIX epoch. If set, only jobs created before or at this timestamp are returned.

params.name: options.minCreationTime
params.description: Milliseconds since the POSIX epoch. If set, only jobs created after or at this timestamp are returned.

params.name: options.parentJobId
params.description: If set, show only child jobs of the specified parent. Otherwise, show all top-level jobs.

methods.name: dataset
methods.description:
Lazily instantiates a dataset. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a dataset please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Dataset.

If the dataset is owned by a different project than the project used to authenticate the client, provide the project ID as the second argument.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the dataset to request.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The id of the project. Defaults to current project id.

methods.name: datasets
methods.description: Fetches datasets in the project.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.all
params.description: Whether to list all datasets, including hidden ones. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: An expression for filtering the results of the request by label. The syntax is "labels.[:]". Multiple filters can be ANDed together by connecting with a space. Example: "labels.department:receiving labels.active". See Filtering datasets using labels for details.

methods.name: createDataset
methods.description:
Creates a dataset.

Please note that by default the library will not attempt to retry this call on your behalf. Additionally, if a default location is provided in the client configuration it will be used when creating the dataset.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the dataset to create.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the Dataset Resource API docs

methods.name: runJob
methods.description: Starts a job in a synchronous fashion, waiting for the job to complete before returning.

params.name: config
params.description: The job configuration.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to retry, checking if the job has completed. Defaults to 100.

methods.name: startJob
methods.description: Starts a job in an asynchronous fashion. In this case, it will be required to manually trigger a call to wait for job completion.

params.name: config
params.description: The job configuration.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: int64
methods.description: Create an Int64 object. This can be used to work with 64 bit integers as a string value while on a 32 bit platform.

params.name: value
params.description: The 64 bit integer value in string format.

methods.name: time
methods.description: Create a Time object.

params.name: value

methods.name: timestamp
methods.description: Create a Timestamp object.

params.name: value
params.description: The timestamp value.

methods.name: numeric
methods.description:
Create a Numeric object.

Numeric represents a value with a data type of Numeric.

It supports a fixed 38 decimal digits of precision and 9 decimal digits of scale, and values are in the range of -99999999999999999999999999999.999999999 to 99999999999999999999999999999.999999999.

params.name: value
params.description: The Numeric value.

methods.name: bigNumeric
methods.description:
Create a BigNumeric object.

Numeric represents a value with a data type of BIGNUMERIC.

It supports 76.76 (the 77th digit is partial) decimal digits of precision and 38 decimal digits of scale. Values are in the range of -5.7896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819968E+38 to 5.7896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819967E+38.

params.name: value
params.description: The Numeric value.

methods.name: geography
methods.description: Create a Geography object.

params.name: value
params.description: The geography data in WKT format.
